de.fhb.sailboat.ufer.prototyp.utility

Class ConfigWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fhb.sailboat.ufer.prototyp.utility.ConfigWriter

  • public class ConfigWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to write configuration files using the ConfigMap-format.
    Author:
    Patrick Rutter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConfigWriter(ConfigMap configMap)
      Loads an already existing HashMap (use this constructor in conjunction with ConfigReader.getConfigMap to alter/ append existing files.)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean fileExists(java.io.File path)
      Returns true only if the chosen file already exists
      boolean fileExists(java.lang.String fileName)
      Returns true only if a file with the chosen name exists already in the working directory of the application.
      void writeConfigFile(java.io.File path)
      Writes the current configMap Entries to a textfile.
      void writeConfigFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      Writes the current configMap Entries to a file in the current working directory of the application.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • writeConfigFile

        public void writeConfigFile(java.io.File path)
        Writes the current configMap Entries to a textfile. Takes no action if the configMap is empty.
        Parameters:
        path - of the file to be written

      • writeConfigFile

        public void writeConfigFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Writes the current configMap Entries to a file in the current working directory of the application. Takes no action if the configMap is empty.
        Parameters:
        fileName -
